assertions: Valid: Both block and vars present
Invalid: Missing vars (vars is required even if empty)

x-specs.when: block is block name in kebab-case
x-specs.then: it should look up and instantiate matching block template

assertions: block property: Template name lookup mechanism
Reference 1: block='icon-badge' → finds block with name='icon-badge'
Reference 2: block='cta-button' → finds block with name='cta-button'
Each reference instantiates its corresponding template
block property value MUST match existing block name exactly

x-specs.then: it should validate kebab-case naming at build time

assertions: Valid: 'icon-badge', 'cta', 'section-header-2', 'my-component'
Invalid: 'IconBadge' (uppercase), 'cta_button' (underscore)
Invalid: 'section header' (space), '2-columns' (starts with digit), '' (empty)
Pattern ensures block matches block naming convention
Naming pattern: ^[a-z][a-z0-9-]*$ (kebab-case)
Valid: 'icon-badge', 'cta', 'section-header-2', 'my-component'
Must start with lowercase letter: [a-z]
Can contain: lowercase letters, digits, hyphens
Invalid: 'IconBadge' (uppercase), 'cta_button' (underscore), 'section header' (space)
Invalid: '2-columns' (starts with digit), '' (empty string)
Build-time validation enforces consistent naming

x-specs.when: block value must match existing block name in blocks array
x-specs.then: it should fail validation if referenced block doesn't exist

assertions: Valid: block='icon-badge' exists in blocks array
Invalid: block='non-existent-block' not found in blocks array
Build-time validation ensures all references resolve
Prevents runtime errors from missing block templates
Reference validation: block value MUST exist in blocks array
Valid: block='icon-badge' → Found in blocks[] ✓
Invalid: block='non-existent-block' → NOT found in blocks[] ✗
Build-time validation prevents broken references
Catches typos and missing block definitions early
Prevents runtime errors from unresolved templates

x-specs.then: it should provide all data needed for template substitution

assertions: vars object: Data container for template substitution

vars.role='Developer' → replaces $role in first span
vars.email='john@example.com' → replaces $email in second span
All template variables receive data from vars object
vars provides complete dataset for single block instance

x-specs.then: it should validate JavaScript naming convention for variables

assertions: Valid: color, iconName, titleText, isActive (camelCase)
Invalid: 'text-color' (hyphen), '1stValue' (starts with digit), '' (empty)
Pattern enforces JavaScript variable naming
Consistent with $variable placeholders in templates
Variable naming: ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$ (JavaScript convention)
Valid: 'color', 'iconName', 'titleText', 'isActive' (camelCase)
Must start with letter: [a-zA-Z]
Can contain: letters and digits only
Invalid: 'text-color' (hyphen not allowed), '1stValue' (starts with digit), '' (empty)
Matches $variable placeholders in templates ($color, $iconName, etc.)

x-specs.when: vars values replace $variable placeholders in block template

Step 2: Look up in vars (variant='success', message='Saved successfully!')
Step 3: Replace 'alert-$variant' → 'alert-success'
Step 4: Replace '$message' → 'Saved successfully!'
Final DOM: NO $ symbols, only concrete values
Abstract template → Concrete component transformation

assertions: Block reference mechanism: block property references template name, vars provides instance data
Template lookup: block='team-member' resolves to matching block in blocks array
Variable substitution: $photo, $name, $position, $bio replaced with vars values
Multiple instances: Same template generates 3 unique instances with different data
Unique identifiers: data-testid suffixes (-0, -1, -2) enable individual instance testing
Structural consistency: All instances share identical HTML structure (card → img → h4 → p → p)
Content variation: Only data varies (photos, names, positions, bios) while structure stays same
Single source of truth: Modify template once → all instances update automatically
DRY principle: No code duplication, reusable components via template + reference pattern
Cross-page reuse: feature-item block used on Home page with different data
Naming validation: block names must match ^[a-z][a-z0-9-]*$ (kebab-case)
Required properties: Both block and vars are required (even if vars is empty {})
Build-time validation: References to non-existent blocks fail validation
Template instantiation: Abstract template + concrete data = rendered component
Data-driven UI: Same component structure, multiple data instances pattern

integrationPoints: Blocks array: Global registry of reusable block templates
Block template system: Define once, reference many times across pages
Variable substitution: $variable placeholders in templates resolved from vars object
Props schema: Block props follow block-props.schema.json for flexible property definitions
Children schema: Block children follow block-children.schema.json for nested structures
Page sections: Block references embedded in page sections for composition
Data-testid generation: Automatic unique suffixes (-0, -1, -2) for instance identification
Naming convention: Kebab-case block names (^[a-z][a-z0-9-]*$) for consistency
Build-time validation: Schema validates all references resolve to existing blocks
Component library: Blocks array acts as design system component library
Template instantiation: Runtime system clones template and substitutes variables
DRY architecture: Single template definition eliminates component code duplication
